column1: Narrator : The musicians are akwardly standing there. They seem down.
column7: Narrator : The whole room is dancing to the music. The tavern’s got its musical spirit back!
column12: OtherSpeak : Tell me you found a trumpet!
column14: OtherSpeak : So did you find a guitar?
column16: OtherSpeak : You’ve got a lute for us right?
column18: OtherSpeak : I hope you have found an accordion!
column20: OtherSpeak : The flute, do you have it now?

column7: OtherSpeak : Here is our bandmaster! Look at that, everyone’s merrily dancing thanks to you!
column12: OtherSpeak : Look at these people, they need some good music to cheer them up…
column14: OtherSpeak : Everyone looks so sad, we need music now!
column16: OtherSpeak : This place is so depressing without some good tunes.
column18: OtherSpeak : Hear that dead silence? That’s why we need music right now!
column20: OtherSpeak : No one’s dancing, this is so sad.

column1: OtherSpeak : Our trumpetist lost his instrument...
column2: OtherSpeak : Somebody sat on our guitarist's instrument and it's broken beyond repair.
column3: OtherSpeak : Somebody used the lute of our pal here to do indescribable things so he cannot use it again...
column4: OtherSpeak : Some drunk geezer stole our accordion the other night and ran away with it.
column5: OtherSpeak : Our flutist lost his instrument because someone mistook it for a... for something else. And now it's unusable.

column1: OtherSpeak : If you ever find a trumpet one day
column2: OtherSpeak : If you find one by any chance during your travels,
column3: OtherSpeak : If you ever find one during your journey, adventurer
column4: OtherSpeak : If you find one by any chance
column5: OtherSpeak : If you ever find a flute somewhere

column1: OtherSpeak : Bring it to us, so he can play his famous solo again!
column2: OtherSpeak : Please bring it back here, we’re nothing without his chords!
column3: OtherSpeak : Please bring it here, so he may charm the tavern with his beautiful melodies again.
column4: OtherSpeak : Please bring it to us, we’re nothing without his old melodies
column5: OtherSpeak : Bring it to us, we’re lost without his catchy little tunes

column1: OtherSpeak: I’ll pay you a drink!
column2: OtherSpeak: I’ll buy you a drink!
column3: OtherSpeak: I’ll buy you some drinks!
column4: OtherSpeak: We’ll get you something to drink if you do!
column5: OtherSpeak: I’ll buy you a drink if you do!

column6: Choice : I don’t have any, sorry...
column8: Choice : I got nothing, sorry mate.
column10: Choice : I have nothing for you, sorry...
column14: Choice : I don’t have anything, sorry.
column18: Choice : I’ve got nothing, but I’ll look around.
column20: Choice : I don’t have anything, sorry...

column2: OtherSpeak : Oh no, what are we going to do!
column3: OtherSpeak : But you don’t have anything!
column11: OtherSpeak : But you don’t have any...
column18: OtherSpeak : Don’t forget about us, please!
column20: OtherSpeak : We just want to make people dance! Help us, please!

column5: OtherSpeak : That’s perfect, thank you so much!
column9: OtherSpeak : A fine instrument, thank you, that's perfect!
column13: OtherSpeak : It’s a bit dirty but it’ll do just fine, thanks a lot!
column17: OtherSpeak : It smells funny, but it’ll have to do, thanks!

column1: OtherSpeak : Let me get you something to drink, my friend!
column5: OtherSpeak : Please, let me get you something to drink!
column9: OtherSpeak : Here, let me buy you a drink as thanks!
column13: OtherSpeak : Let me get you something to drink!
column17: OtherSpeak : Let’s have a drink, it’s on me!
